page.title: 05Employment in Newburgh
page.content: {Quarrying}is an important industry in Newburgh. The main quarry, Bell's, quarries stone for roads and also has teams of men for roadmaking and repairing. Robertson's no longer has a quarry, but still makes and repairs roads. The main employer in the town was the{Floorcovering Factory,}but it closed down in 1979. Many people were paid off when the factory closed. The{Courtalds group}have a small factory in the town. It waterproofs material which is used to make clothing for the Police and the Armed Forces. Unfortunately, the factory has paid off some of its workers recently. Some people work on the River Tay net-fishing for{salmon and trout. The surrounding countryside has many{farms.}These are mainly{arable and stock rearing farms.
